_aChangeLog.text: Improved bots and hostages movement through a ladder (BackDoor)
Total improvement of comlete Navigation Mesh
Changed Place Names (more detailed and suitable)

_sText:
Counter-Strike: Source : Bot's Navigation Mesh for the map CS_ONSLAUGHTDAY

Nav Creator: Meurglis3, Release Date: February 25 2014

Here is the Navigation Mesh for nice urban-themed map cs_onslaughtday by neozyem (released April 2012). It's a fully reworked and manually optimized .nav-file (because in original author's BSP was embedded slightly edited auto-gen NAV).

Most areas and paths were remade manually and some additional paths were created from scratch. Some broken-off important pathways were restored (in particular ways for hostages on both ladders). Also the set of other inaccuracies were corrected.

OK, bots (and hostages) have opportunity to use all walkable ways now. And they don't intend to concede to the opponent without fight ;-)

NOTE: For possibility of comparison and in-game testing the original navigation file by map creator embedded in .bsp and available to downloading with the same map.

Fight and Fun! Your responses and remarks are always welcomed :-)

Credits and Gratitudes: neozyem (for high detailed and very realistic urban-themed map).

Additional Gratitudes: BarnDoor (for perfect playable navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps), Chizbone (for informative and clever article BOT_BRAINED and a set of excellent navigation meshes), CoCoNUT (for fine hand-tuned navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps), Valve Developer Community (for learning articles by Navigation Meshes and Navigation Mesh Commands).

Never Say Die!
